intro: Epilobium sugaharae, commonly known as Sugahara's willow herb, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to Japan and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
